name: Chat with Conversational AI Assistant
definition: This service enables users to engage in a natural language conversation with a conversational AI assistant. It accepts text queries and provides concise, clear, and helpful responses that may include answers, explanations, summaries, or clarifications. It supports multi-turn dialogues and handling of complex topics.

name: Edit and Transform Text
definition: This capability allows users to perform structured text editing operations including find-and-replace, templating, batch renaming, and content transformations. Input: Text content along with specific editing instructions or transformation rules. Output: Modified text content reflecting the requested changes.

name: Answer Questions
definition: This capability allows users to ask natural language questions and receive text-based responses. It covers both general inquiries and Gaia-related topics by leveraging the appropriate task agent (such as an OWL-based general AI assistant or a Gaia Task Agent) to provide accurate answers.

name: Execute Academic Signal Processing Task
definition: This capability processes academic signals by performing a complete end-to-end task that includes data collection, interpretation, recommendation, and report generation. It accepts an input query specifying details such as the date (or time range) and academic domain (e.g., artificial intelligence progress, machine learning papers, deep learning development) and produces a comprehensive academic report summarizing the collected signals, analytical interpretations, recommendations, and findings.

name: Comprehensive Prompt Optimization
definition: This capability refines and optimizes a user-provided prompt, including performing iterative improvements based on specific refinement feedback. It accepts a textual prompt (and optionally accompanying feedback) as input and produces an enhanced version of the prompt designed to improve AI response quality and effectiveness.

name: Validate Mermaid Syntax
definition: This capability checks the correctness of Mermaid syntax in a given code snippet. It accepts Mermaid code as input and outputs a validation result indicating whether the syntax is correct, along with any error messages if applicable.

name: Extract, Filter, and Recommend Papers
definition: This capability accepts input containing one or more ArXiv paper IDs, either as part of a structured JSON object or embedded in natural language text. The agent automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs from the input, retrieves full metadata for each paper, applies intelligent filtering, sorting, and ranking based on predefined semantic rules or internal logic, and returns a JSON list of recommended ArXiv paper IDs in ranked order (up to 8 papers).

name: Extract and Analyze Papers from ArXiv
definition: This capability accepts an input, either as plain text or a structured JSON object, that may contain one or more ArXiv paper IDs. It automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs, retrieves the corresponding papers from the ArXiv platform, and conducts in-depth content analysis and summarization. The output is a JSON list where each element is a Markdown-formatted report of the analyzed paper.
alias: Extract and Analyze Papers from Text

name: Extract IDs and Download PDF
definition: This capability accepts a natural language text input that includes one or more ArXiv paper IDs. It automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs from the text, downloads the associated PDF files, converts each file into a Base64 encoded string, and returns a JSON list with each element representing a Base64 encoded PDF content.

name: Analyze Research Papers
definition: This capability accepts research papers provided in various formats, such as attached PDF files, text inputs, or links to academic articles. It conducts a deep content analysis that includes summarization and extraction of potential research ideas and directions, producing detailed analysis reports.

name: Identify research gaps
definition: This capability accepts inputs such as academic literature or descriptions of a research field and produces a list of research gaps and unexplored areas based on the analyzed content.

name: Search Academic Papers
definition: This capability accepts a natural language query or a structured JSON query to search academic papers across multiple databases, such as arXiv and Semantic Scholar. It processes the input using natural language processing and returns a formatted list of relevant papers with metadata including titles, authors (with publication year), a truncated abstract, source information, and available links, such as those to the full paper and PDF.

name: Review Academic Paper
definition: This capability reviews an academic paper provided either as a PDF file or via a URL input. It accepts a PDF file (with a name ending in .pdf and base64-encoded content) or a URL pointing to an academic paper (such as an arXiv link), and automatically downloads the corresponding PDF when needed. The system extracts text and metadata, and generates a comprehensive review report that includes scores for methodology, novelty, clarity, and significance, along with a detailed analysis covering a summary, strengths, weaknesses, and questions.

name: Greeting and Help
definition: This capability handles user greetings and provides information about the agent's functionalities. When a user sends a greeting or asks for help, it responds with explanations of the available capabilities, such as reviewing academic papers via PDF uploads or URL inputs, and offers guidance on how to use these services effectively.

name: Browse the Web
definition: This capability accepts a text query from the user asking for information (e.g., 'What is the weather today?' or 'Search for information about a topic'), performs a web browsing search, and returns relevant content including summaries, links, or data gathered from the web.
